data.title: Student Resume Submission and Project Applications

content.text: okay so here i want to make some changes i also wanted to add that the user with role student and can submit there resume and about themself that will be stored in the db how can i make that possible ?
also explain me how will the student apply for project ?

okay so here i want to make some changes i also wanted to add that the user with role student and can submit there resume and about themself that will be stored in the db how can i make that possible ?
also explain me how will the student apply for project ?

I'll help you implement the functionality for students to submit their resumes and apply for projects. Let's first explore the current codebase to understand the existing structure and then determine what changes are needed.

Let's start by examining the user entity and related files:

Let's look at the UserController:
Let's check if there are any repositories for applications:
Let's search for any repository related to applications:
wait in user controller don't i hvae to send the JWT ? to get the information ?
wait in user controller don't i hvae to send the JWT ? to get the information ?

You're absolutely right. In the UserController, you need to extract the user information from the JWT token to identify the authenticated user. Let me revise the approach for the UserController, focusing on the file you have open.

Let's look at how authentication is handled in your project:
Let's check the JwtProvider to understand how tokens are generated:
Let's also check the JwtTokenValidator:
Let's also check the AuthController to see how authentication is handled:
Now let's check the CustomUserDetailService:
wait shouldn't i send the jwt token everytime in the request and accept it in the requestheaders ?>
wait shouldn't i send the jwt token everytime in the request and accept it in the requestheaders ?>
also we can write thre buisnesss logic in the service and then call them from the controller nopw give meboth
also we can write thre buisnesss logic in the service and then call them from the controller nopw give meboth
okay so indtead of name userservice lets devide them with the Student service and faculty service
okay so indtead of name userservice lets devide them with the Student service and faculty service

I see you want to refactor the code to use a service layer instead of putting business logic directly in the controllers. This is a great approach for better separation of concerns. Let's create separate services for students and faculty.

Let me create the service layer structure and then update the controllers to use these services:
in these i should also send the ID's right ?
in these i should also send the ID's right ?
no no i mean accepting ID's so that we can easily get and make changes in the db
no no i mean accepting ID's so that we can easily get and make changes in the db

I see what you mean now. You want to modify the service methods to accept IDs as parameters rather than just email addresses, which would make it easier to work with the database. Let me look at the current StudentService interface to understand what changes we need to make.
Let's also look at the UserEntity class to understand its structure and ID field:
also imlement the feedback in student as student can comment on faculty
also imlement the feedback in student as student can comment on faculty

I see you want to implement feedback functionality where students can provide feedback on faculty. Let's look at the FeedBack entity you have open and then implement this feature in the StudentService.

Looking at your FeedBack.java file, I can see it's set up to allow students to provide feedback on projects. The entity has:
- An ID
- Comments and rating fields
- A timestamp (givenAt)
- Relationships to both a student and a project

To implement feedback functionality where students can comment on faculty, we need to:

1. First, check if we need to modify the FeedBack entity to support feedback on faculty
2. Add methods to the StudentService interface
3. Implement these methods in the StudentServiceImplementation class

Let's start by examining the FeedBack entity more closely and see if we need to modify it:
Let's also check if there's a FeedbackRepository:
We need to create a FeedBackRepository. Let's also check the Project entity to understand its relationship with faculty:
let feeback entity also have the project and faculty so that we know student gave feedback to who
let feeback entity also have the project and faculty so that we know student gave feedback to who

Great! The FEEDBACK_TYPE enum is already defined with the two types we need: PROJECT and FACULTY.

Now, let's check if there's a FeedBackRepository:
no no do not implement ID based methods i have not written id based in my implementation give normal
no no do not implement ID based methods i have not written id based in my implementation give normal
